headline: Sugar Cookies with Buttercream Frosting
description: These cookies are melt-in-your-mouth delicious. They are simple to make and kids love to lick the frosting off the tops. Butter flavoring is in the buttercream for added flavor. You can find it in most supermarkets, in the baking aisle, where there are other flavorings such as vanilla.
name: Sugar Cookies with Buttercream Frosting

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mix together butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; gradually stir flour mixture into butter mixture until well blended using a sturdy spoon. Chill dough for 2 hours.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into desired shapes using cookie cutters. Place cookies 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 4 to 6 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove cookies from pan and cool on wire racks.
Using an electric mixer, beat shortening, confectioners sugar, water, salt, vanilla extract, and butter flavoring until fluffy. Frost cookies after they have cooled completely.

review.reviewBody: Great recipe. I used about 4 teaspoons of vanilla (instead of just 1 teaspoon), but made no other changes, and I’m still giving it 5 stars because everything else about the recipe works well. After refrigerating overnight, the dough was easy to roll and cut. It does puff a little while baking, but not too much, and it gives the cookies a wonderful texture. It is important to use butter (not margarine), measure the flour carefully, and chill the dough thoroughly before rolling/cutting. If you want a sweeter cookie, sprinkle sugar on top before baking or add icing after baking.
Loved this recipe! My honey said they were so good! They are very light and fluffy!!!! Super easy to make and roll out, unlike many other recipes I’ve tried.
delish
I used a different icing, but the cookies were good! Easy to make and held their shape well.

This dough was so nice to work with! I made the dough the day before baking and it was great. I skimped a bit on sugar as cookies often are too sweet for me, and I shouldn’t have. But with the frosting these will be awesome. I plan to use a different recipe for the frosting with the comments here. I’d absolutely make these cookies again.

This is one of the best Christmas cookies recipes! I made them as directed except I cooked them for 6 minutes at 375 degrees. I was worried about the amount of shortening in the icing recipe. I topped them with the Glossy Royal Icing from this website (1 tablespoon of white corn syrup mixed into 1/4 cup of warm water with a teaspoon of almond extract. Add 3 cups of powdered sugar and an optional teaspoon of vanilla extract).
I used a different frosting recipe so this review is just for the cookies. Easy and tasty made just as written.
Love this cookie! I didn’t use the frosting, but the dough was great. Soft yet crispy

Easy to follow and melts in your mouth without being too sweet. I used a hand mixer and had no trouble with any part of the recipe. I also had no trouble holding color in the frosting. This is a keeper!
Worked well for cutout cookies but not much flavor or sweetness. Double flavoring extract.
Best sugar cookie I have had!!
Absolutely hands down the most buttery soft perfect rolled sugar cookie on the planet. I can't say thank you enough. AMAZING!!!
I only used the cookie recipe, it was a May Day hit for my family and the office
I left out the butter flavored extract and replace the shortening with butter and they always turn out great!
I made the cookies and they were delicious.. I did not use the frosting recipe this time, maybe next time :-)

Perfect recipe to make a traditional cut out sugar cookie. If you want to make this even more over the top divine try adding a couple of teaspoons of Allspice to the flour mixture before adding it to the butter mixture. Tastes exactly how my mother's and grandmother's sugar cut outs tasted when I add the allspice. Perfection!

These cookies came out soft like I wanted and the buttercream frosting combination really balanced out the whole cookie so it wasn't too sweet either. Kids are going to have a blast decorating these! Thanks!
Wonderful and easy to make.
They were fine, but I wasn't particularly impressed with either the cookie or the frosting.
I had some issues with the dough, it was too crumbly.
cookie recipe is great. the icing is awful. kids didn't like. remade with my own buttercream recipe with butter instead of shortening then we had a winner

I LOVE these cookies! I have made these cookies three times and I prefer almond extract instead of vanilla extract. I thought it made them more "sugar cookie" and less "shortbread". Will definitely be making these again!
OMG THIS IS SO GOOD.
Simply delicious...

This were a runny mess. I obviously did something wrong. I think it was because I used a mixer to mix in the flour mixer. Next time I’ll use a spoon. I ended up having to spoon the batter onto the cookie sheet. Cookies actually tasted good but was disappointed that I couldn’t roll them out and use cutters.

These cookies were delicious!! I made these for Halloween, with intent to frost them, but they were gone before I got the chance! My family loved them and I would definitely make these again, and hopefully get to frost them this time!! :)
Easy enough for my 6 year old to make! The cookies are perfect sweetness to add frosting too (though we use a different frosting) & not be overly sweet. Excellent recipe!
These were too good. I was mad cuz I didn’t make two batches instead of one. I will be making these on a regular basis. Thank you allrecipes! Gallon in love wit yall

The cookies came out great - soft and buttery! But it is quite labor-intensive. After chilling the dough it is hard as a rock and requires quite a bit of pounding before it can be rolled out and cut. I decided NOT to use buttercream frosting and I'm glad - the cookie is plenty sweet, and I think the buttercream would have been overwhelming. I just brushed on a simple glaze made of milk, confectioner's sugar, and vanilla.
The recipe turned out exactly as described and baking for only 6 minutes at 400 degrees was perfect. I would like for someone to convert one pound of powdered sugar to cups.

Excellent recipe, cookies are light and fluffy and just melt in your mouth. I didn't make the icing with the shortening and used butter instead and some light cream to thin it and it was perfect, I only used vanilla in the frosting. My cookies took about 7 minutes to bake.
Awesome sugar cookie recipe!! Only one I will use.
Great sugar cookie recipe! Dough was easy for the kids to work with. My new "go to" recipe for sugar cookies.
I've made these so many times. Instantly a family favorite! We do use a different frosting recipe though because the one with this is not good.

I didn't chill the dough...not a good idea. It was very soft and hard to work with. It seemed greasy and the shapes wouldn't stay together. With chilled dough, I think this recipe will deserve 5 stars. With warm dough, maybe 2 1/2. Will definitely chill next time! I didn't use the icing recipe, so I can't rate it. I did, however, use another from Allrecipes.
Made this recipe exactly as is the kids love it!

Love these! Easy to roll and cut out, taste delicious! This is the recipe I will want to use from now on. I did roll them out on parchment paper and sprinkled a combo of flour and powdered sugar to roll them in. Used Mom's icing recipe because it is the BEST and I don't like shortening in the frosting.

I made the cookies and they were terriffic. I ran out of all-purpose flour and had to sub about half whole wheat flour, and they still tasted great. I look forward to trying them again without the substitution.

I skipped the icing for another recipe based on some of the comments.
This was my first time making sugar cookies, and my first time making frosting. They were far easier than I anticipated, and so delicious! Definitely making these again.

Literally the best sugar cookie recipe I've ever made! Doubled the recipe, used margarine instead of butter, and did my own sort of butter cream/royal icing with mint flavoring. I cooked then about 7 minutes a batch, they were moist, crumbly and perfect! Vthe kids liked them even without the icing! Definitely my new forever sugar cookie recipe!
This recipe is fool proof, loved it. I might be a baker after all.
Love this recipe. Heads up, you may need to bake longer than than 4-6 minutes, which for any of us bakers is no big deal. I will continue to use this recipe.
Tasted great and was easy to roll once the chilled dough warmed up a bit. I should have removed the dough from the refrigerator about 30 minutes ahead of time.

I have made these cookies several times and they always turn out perfect. I do not use the icing recipe included for my particular taste I prefer not to have shortening in my icing although I did find another delicious hardening icing that is simply powdered sugar vanilla and milk.

I've only made the cookies sans frosting since our family isn't fond of frosting. They are delicious! Buttery, with the right combo of crispy outside and flaky/soft inside. I rounded vanilla to 2 tsp. Def a keeper for holiday cookies!

I love it! I'm 11 and I've made this twice... one time with the frosting that comes with it. This is the only reason I'm giving this a 4 star. I used butter instead of shortening and I'm not sure if this was the reason but it was SO runny. I added a LOAD more powdered sugar and then it turned out good. The second time I made this was with royal frosting and it was GREAT! The cookies were good except I ended up baking them for 7-8 minutes because I wanted them hard enough so that they wouldn't fall apart when the icing was on. I brought both versions to school and everyone loved it.

I followed the recipe exactly and the dough was far too sticky to roll out, much less cut. I refrigerated 2hrs, but seeing the state of the dough, tried to give it longer to see if it would come around. Nope. After 5hrs, it was horrific to work with. I ended up putting the dough on my cookie sheet in spoonfulls flattened with a flour coated fork, but even that was a sticky mess. When finished, the cookies weren't that good. Very disappointed.

I am a professional baker and I am always testing out sugar cookie recipes because 
A. They are either too dry or too sweet.
B. I don't care for sugar cookies because I've had too many bad ones.
 Until I made this recipe. I had my daughter's friends over for baking and decorating Halloween cookies and made this dough. The cookies were wonderful. We made icing with shortening ( not butter) and it complimented this very well.
I only made the cookies, not the icing. I love, love, love them!
So soft and chewy. I only baked them for 5 minutes and they turned out perfect :)

Review for Cookie only (did not make the icing). These taste really good. The only change I made was not adding the vanilla (didn't have any) My family still really like the taste, and we will be making these again! I did have some issues with using cookie cutters on them, the dough seemed to get really soft too quick, then the shapes just kinda melded back together and had to go into the freezer for a bit in order for me to get them onto the cooking sheet. But other than that, it was easy to make, they did only take 5 minutes to cook and I use a stone to cook them on. Great cookie recipe
These came out perfectly! I made the dough one day and rolled it out the next. Loved the cookies. Not too sweet.
Amazing cookies
The cookies are great, and easy to make. The frosting however, was gritty I would make the cookies again, but not the frosting.

I made these cookies today and they were awesome. Easy dough to work with and easy ingredients. I baked them a little longer than what the recipe calls for but they continue to bake after you take them out of the oven so you have to be careful when adding time to the cooking time. I found keeping the dough in the fridge for 2 hours a little too long. Next time I would only put the dough in the fridge for about 1 hour. Certainly a recipe keeper.
I added 1/2 tsp of butter flavoring with the vanilla.
This type is very simple yet delicious. The buttercream just has that type of flavor that goes right in with the cookies.

I didn't make the frosting, but the cookies are flawless! We split the dough in half and chilled each for 30 minutes before rolling out and cutting cookies out with mini cookie cutter/punches. They were adorable and delicious! We cooked them for 6 minutes as we like the edges a little toasty. Highly recommend. Didn't alter the recipe at all.
Easy and crisp outside, soft inside. Just the way I like em!
Just made the dough. It is chilling in the fridge. Dough is a bit saltier than I expected but Delish. Next time, a tad less salt for us. But it is good! Very good!!
These are perfect even without icing. They maintained their moist and soft texture even a week later (I know, I can't believe there were any left after a whole week!). Thank you for sharing.
Thee best sugar cookies ever!!! They were gone in minutes and everyone was raving about them for days!
I can't say anything about the frosting but I've made the cookie part of the recipe several times. It's easy and they always turn out great.

I only had time to make the cookies , not the frosting. The cookies are wonderful! They cut out beautifully, bake quickly, and are easy to decorate. The cookies are soft and chewy and smooth. I'll keep using this recipe

I can't rate the icing because I only made the cookies but so far this is one of my favorites. I refrigerated the dough overnight and it was still very easy to work with the next day. This recipe made wonderful sugar cookies.

First of all, 5 star taste, and 5 star directions. However, the only way you could possibly get 60 cookies from this recipe is if you used miniature cookie cutters. If you sincerely need more than 30 regular sized sugar cookies, double the recipe. Also, I opted out of the frosting and made a vanilla cream cheese frosting instead which complimented the flavor of these cookies perfectly :)

Loved the cookies but the frosting all u tasted was shortening so I added a few tablespoons of baking chocolate powder and it covered it up I also added a 1/2 teaspoon mint flavor so it was delicious
By the way I had the dough in the fridge overnight I used a glass mixing bowl with lid

I made these exactly as the recipe stated (a double batch though & used my own frosting). The dough was very easy to work with. They weren't overly sweet which I prefer. I gave it four stars only because I have to agree with others who thought it was more like a shortbread/biscuit than a traditional sugar cookie. Still a good recipe

This is the perfect sugar cookie recipe! They come together quickly, taste wonderfully, and I love how quickly they bake! I did not care for the frosting. I will use this cookie recipe for all my cutout cookies from now on.
These tasted like slightly sweetened bread rounds.

These cookies were super easy to make. The dough was easy to work with, and the cookies kept their shape and didn't expand when baked. I used almond extract, which gave them a nice flavor, topped with tinted sugar, and baked them about 7 minutes. That being said, I probably won't make them again, as my family prefers a crisper sugar cookie and these are on the soft side. But it's a great recipe if you're a soft sugar cookie fan!

My teacher and I made these cookies, and they were a little too salty and not very sweet. We made them a second time, and we used 1.25 cups of sugar and only 3 cups of flour. Everyone agreed they were better the second time.

Also, we used red and blue food colouring to make them beautiful, and we put mnms on them before they went in the oven.
I did not care for this recipe.
This is the best sugar cookie recipe I've found where the cookie holds its shape. Great!!
The cookies were easy, and baked up perfect. I did not make the frosting.
Perfect recipe :)

I think I may have just replaced my all-time favorite sugar cookie recipe! Texture, sweetness, and ease all perfect. I was hesitant about the frosting, but I really like it. I'm about to deliver them to my children and grandchildren! The true test!
Best sugar cookie I've ever made. Easy to mix and dough is easy to work with. I'm not a froster, I like traditional colored sugar and sprinkles. 8 minutes in an electric oven was perfect.

I made these with my six-year-old grandson and they turned out great! Sometimes he gets bored part way through a project but he was right with me the whole time on these! He especially liked the taste-testing phase.

I wasn't overly fond of this cookie, not sweet enough for me, I usually like cut out cookies even without the frosting but these need the frosting. Roll the cookies to the thickness that you want as they do not rise, but they do keep their shape well, dough was easy to work with so overall not a bad choice, just like a little sweeter cookie.

This review is solely on the cookies themselves. I made these for the first time today. It was definitely easy to make, and to dough was not too bad to handle. I did chill the dough for about three hours instead of the two recommended. I did not, however, make the icing based on previous reviews. That being said, the taste is kind of bland. These are cookies that need an icing to give them that extra flavor. The cookies are not bad at all, airy and light. They just need a little something to give it that extra "Yum".
These cookies were very good. They rolled out very well and were perfect for decorating. I used purchased frosting so can't rate the entire recipe. I will be making these cookies again.
easy

Maybe something went wrong I cut the recipe in half for me, but these didn't turn out right at all! There was WAY too much flour. I had to add a lot more butter when mixing the dough so it wasn't just dough-colored dust, and even with icing (I just did powdered sugar and milk- I didn't try the buttercream here), they just taste like flour. Maybe the proportions are right if you make the full batch or do the math yourself, but I've never run into problems using that feature before.

This is the perfect dough for cut-outs. The dough did not stick to my cookie cutters, even the vintage ones with enclosed backs. 5 minutes was a good baking time. I chilled the dough overnight and busted into smaller sections to roll out. It is very forgiving and melds into itself well when I had cracks or breaks. This is by far my new favorite sugar cookie recipe as they tasted fantastic! I did not try the frosting recipe. Instead used royal icing then decorated with "Simple & Delicious Butter Cream Frosting"

Excellent (cookie) recipe (Frosting recipe I did not follow)!

Disclaimer: I ATTEMPTED to follow it exactly, however, am in Italy at the moment so I had to use the metric converter, which always seems to short change the flour (I added more until the dough seemed reasonable to roll and didn't stick like crazy to my fingers).

I also had to make my own cookie cutters, which can be done easily by shaping strips of a sliced up pop can (thank you pinterest!!). Therefore, my cookies were RATHER on the small side (obsiously, less than a pop can diameter), and a half receipe turned out to make about 40 of these small little cookies. The cookies were soft and delicious!

I just used butter and powdered sugar with some vanilla for the frosting, because what the heck is the point using shortening and butter flavoring!?

This dough was so easy to work with and tasty both with and without frosting. I didn't use the frosting from this recipe (I used the sugar cookie icing recipe to make). I let the dough sit for an hour in the fridgerator and it was perfect. Thank you!
Super easy to work with! Followed exactly. Frosting was perfect with it. Thanks so much will get lots of use out of this holiday season.

I followed the recipe exactly and found the cookies came out perfectly. I used another icing recipe off this site but the cookies were tasty and looked like they should. I will definitely use this recipe again!!
I followed the recipe exactly and I was worried they might be hard but they turned out soft. I also used a different frosting that dried hard so I could stack them.
Way too much butter very hard to work with.
This is a very delicious frosting recipe. It was smooth and creamy.

This recipe was perfect. I was on the edge about using the frosting recipe because of the mixed reviews, but when I tried another one and it was a total disaster I had to use this one as a back up and everything turned out great. These cookies were delicious!
Best and easiest sugar cookie recipe I have found. I didn't make the frosting, but the cookies were a huge hit at Christmas.

In the end i had to add and egg and cook them a little longer. That being said, they are my favorite type of sugar cookies. They are soft but not chewy just like sugar cookies should be! Even better with frosting and sprinkles.

I've never really been a fan of sugar cookies; they've just been another cookie on the cookie tray. This recipe changed my mind completely - the cookies weren't overwhelmingly sweet, they held their shape (didn't deform while baking), and turned out pleasantly soft after cooling. We ate them all. In like three days. I paired them with Sugar Cookie Icing because I wanted something that would dry hard and travel well. YUM!
My mother in law bakes goods for a popular espresso bar and really liked these cookies. That says a lot. I used a lemon cream cheese frosting instead of the frosting recipe.
The cookies came out with the perfect texture. I used a different frosting recipe.
Just made these and they're so yummy! I skipped the frosting though, these didn't need it. Will be making these again. Thanks!
